channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: EU leaders react to the historic Trump-Putin summit
item.description: European leaders are reacting to the aftermath of the Trump-Putin summit with concern.

item.title: Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy to meet with Trump on Monday
item.description: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will be meeting President Trump at the White House on Monday. However, Trump suggests he favors Vladimir Putin's approach to dealing with the war in Ukraine.

item.title: The Trump-Putin summit is over. What were the big takeaways?
item.description: NPR's White House correspondent takes stock of the meeting President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin had about the war in Ukraine in Anchorage.

item.title: Taking stock of Pope Leo's first 100 days
item.description: It's been 100 days since Pope Leo XIV's election. In that short span, we have learned a lot about his plans and priorities.

item.title: In covering Paris, climate change is becoming an ever-present story
item.description: Eleanor Beardsley shares what it's like to report from Paris, which is experiencing extreme heat due to climate change.

item.title: Tips for how to manage lending money
item.description: NPR's Life Kit has tips on how to manage lending money to friends and loved ones.

item.title: Snoopy and the gang are back for a summer musical
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Craig Schulz and Erik Wiese about their new special, "Snoopy Presents: A Summer Musical."

item.title: As arms race in Asia intensifies, a-bomb survivors make final plea for peace
item.description: While atomic bomb survivors warn the catastrophic risks, leaders of nuclear-armed states and self-proclaimed 'realists' argue that the deterrence of nuclear weapons is what keeps them from being deployed.

item.title: What we know about the summit between Trump and Putin
item.description: After all the buildup the Alaska summit between Presidents Trump and Putin ended quickly â€” just brief statements from both leaders, no questions from reporters and more questions left hanging than answers provided.

item.title: There's a new #1 song in the country, and it comes from an unlikely source
item.description: Nearly every week this summer, there's been an immovable object at the top of Billboard's Hot 100 singles chart: It's "Ordinary" by the singer Alex Warren. That changed this week.
